lines.text: It's a funny thing about being in love. Sometimes it's easier to tell when you are than when you aren't.
Anything logical makes me want to fight for some reason.
I'm going to kiss you like nobody was ever kissed!
You cook like you paint, honey. Fast, colorful and glib.
The world's dead, and everybody in it's dead but you.
One foot in the grave, the other on my neck.
the illogical. Like this moment, for instance.
Want to tell me where you're going, so I'll have something to lie about?
That O'Mara put up a great fight.
What do you know about fighting?
When it comes to modern combat tactics, you're both babies compared to me.
Have a good life, baby. You deserve it.
I don't know what you're doing, but no one expects me to anymore, so it doesn't matter.
You think I know what I'm doing, baby?

Daisy, do you know you've never told me you love me? Don't say it now. I like you for not saying it. Let it grow. Let it grow until loving me means loving the earth, and all that's sweet and green and mellow and exciting on the face of the earth and the face of the ocean.
